item.title: UK Motor Insurance Law in the EU: Road Accidents and Off-Road Responsibilities
item.description:
James Marson (Reader in Law, Sheffield Hallam University), Katy Ferris (Assistant Professor in Business Law, Nottingham University Business School) and Neil Fletcher (Senior Lecturer, Sheffield Hallam University) Introduction While the UK has seen notable legal victories concerning member state liability for breaches of EU law, the ability to hold the state accountable for individual losses remains limited. Establishing a breach significant enough to warrant damages is often a hurdle, except in motor vehicle insurance law...

item.title: The opinion of Advocate General Sharpston on the legality of 'defeat devices' in diesel motor vehicles (Case C-693/18, CLCV and Others)
item.description:
